metadata.Name: OBSINFOX
metadata.Description: A corpus of 100 documents selected from 17 sources of French press considered unreliable, annotated with 11 labels by 8 annotators. The dataset focuses on identifying features characteristic of fake news and comparing them to automated classifier predictions.
metadata.Paper Title: A Multi-Label Dataset of French Fake News: Human and Machine Insights
Affiliations: Institut Jean-Nicod, CNRS, ENS-PSL, EHESS, France
Université de Rennes, CNRS, Inria, IRISA, France
European Union Agency for Railways, France
metadata.Abstract: We present a corpus of 100 documents, named obsinfox, selected from 17 sources of French press considered unreliable by expert agencies, annotated using 11 labels by 8 annotators. By collecting more labels than usual, by more annotators than is typically done, we can identify features that humans consider as characteristic of fake news, and compare them to the predictions of automated classifiers. We present a topic and genre analysis using gatecloud, indicative of the prevalence of satire-like text in the corpus. We then use the subjectivity analyzer vago, and a neural version of it, to clarify the link between ascriptions of the label Subjective and ascriptions of the label Fake News. The annotated dataset is available online at the following url: url{https://github.com/obs-info/obsinfox}
